text: <extra_id_0> MIP-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is a powerful <extra_id_0> chemokine <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> that contributes to recruitment of neutrophils [ 27 ] .

<extra_id_0> MIP-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is undetectable or present at low levels under physiological conditions , and shows transient increases under pathological conditions via <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and / or <extra_id_0> interleukin-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) - dependent mechanisms [ 14 ] .

Thus , it would be plausible that <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated <extra_id_0> MIP-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression may provoke SE - induced neutrophil infiltrations .
To confirm this hypothesis , we investigated <extra_id_0> MIP-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression in the PC .

Consistent with our previous study [ 20 ] , some <extra_id_0> MIP-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - positive astrocytes were observed in the core and periphery of the vasogenic edema lesions , but not in the non-vasogenic edema region ( Figure 6B and 6C ) .

Although the number of <extra_id_0> MIP-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> positive cells per unit area in the PC region of s <extra_id_0> TNFp55R <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - infused animals was significantly lower than that of the saline-infused group due to reduction of the area of vasogenic edema , there was no difference in the number of <extra_id_0> MIP-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> positive cells per unit area of vasogenic edema between s <extra_id_0> TNFp55R <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - infused animals and saline-infused animals ( Figure 6F ) .

Furthermore , the number of <extra_id_0> MIP-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - positive cells showed a direct proportion to the unit area of vasogenic edema with a linear coefficient of correlation of 0.682 ( p < 0.05 , Figure 6G ) .

Therefore , together with reduction in neutrophil infiltration in the PC region of s <extra_id_0> TNFp55R <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - infused animals , our findings provide evidence that <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> may regulate SE - induced neutrophil infiltration at least in the PC via vasogenic edema formation and not via direct <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated <extra_id_0> MIP-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression in astrocytes .
